contactUs.title: Contact Us
contactUs.subTitle: Please enter your contact details below. Once completed, send the form using the “submit” button below the form. Once the form has been sent, your e-mail application will open. You can also contact us directly by e-mail:

subject.title: Reasons for Contacting Us
subject.followingUp: Following Up on a Previous Request

contactUs.formTitle: Give feedback, ask for help or contact us to find out more.
contactUs.name: Name

thankYou.title: Thank you for your message
thankYou.message: We have received your message and thank you for contacting us. We will get back to you as soon as possible.

sbom.title: Software Bill of Materials (SBOM)
sbom.para: 30 day object retention policy. SBOM collected for whole application on any service's push to main branch.

accessibility.title: Accessibility Compliance Scans
accessibility.para: 30-day object retention policy. Accessibility scans are performed when there is a commit to the UI codebase on any branch.

test-coverage.title: Test Coverage
test-coverage.para: 30-day object retention policy. Coverage reported here is total statements - click 'View Results' to see more.

control-compliance.title: Control Compliance
control-compliance.para: 30 day object retention. Using Kyverno (with only a couple of controls to start).

vulnerabilities.title: Vunerabilities
vulnerabilities.para: <0>Renovate</0> continuously scans the source code in GitHub, which will include any development dependencies, for vulnerabilities. Renovate will automatically create PRs with patches for these dependencies. The vulnerabilities represented here are the ones detected by the Artifact Registry. This is done automatically when a new image is pushed, as well as several times a day until the container image is one month old. The objects listed here also have a 30-day retention policy. The SHA listed here refers to the Artifact Registry digest. The GitHub commit SHA can be retrieved from the image tag.

landingPage.title: Welcome to Safe Inputs Dashboard
landingPage.landingPagePara: This is an inital effort at dashboarding some DevSecOps outputs. We only have a handful of metrics at the moment, but iteratively working to expand this. More details such as GitHub configurations and uptime metrics can be found on the Observatory.
landingPage.landingPagePara2: Please let us know if you have any feedback.
landingPage.vulnerabilityPara: These are vulnerabilities currently present in the Artifact Registry for the most recent commits. The Artifact Registry will scan images younger than 30 days, and there is a 30-day storage bucket retention policy for the results. This will only display information on non-stale images. Fails if contains Critical or High vulnerabilities.
landingPage.accessibilityPara: Summary is for the most recent commit per branch. Designated as fail if any violations occur.
landingPage.testCoveragePara: This summary is for the Main branch only - for all branches, see the Code Coverage section. There is a 30-day object retention policy on the storage bucket, so results will only include recently updated modules. Designated as fail if test coverage drops greater or equal to 10%.
landingPage.controlCompliancePara: Automated with Kyverno. Retention policy 30 days.
